falsificationAttempts.description: Looked for dependents that would break if experiment-level counts were removed and only stored on runs.
falsificationAttempts.result: `buildExperimentSpecSignature` serializes the counts, and the lab editor/experiment detail views read the same fields from `config.scoring_stage`, so dual-source counts or fallbacks would create ambiguity unless these dependencies are rewritten.

counterEvidence.description: Templates and run configs rely on the spec signature that currently embeds counts, so keeping experiment-level counts as fallback is needed just to preserve dedup/checksum behavior.
The Lab editor and experiment detail UI treat counts as experiment-borne fields, so any migration must first move or extend those inputs rather than relying on run_config fallbacks.

notes: Because the existing system tightly couples counts to experiment config for template uniqueness and UI contracts, the claimed minimal migration (with run-level fallbacks) exposes contradictions in the assumptions.
